body_html:
We think this issue is occuring because the version of PyTorch installed to generate the model is not the same as the version of libtorch.so being used to run it. Can you try downing a new nightly pytorch (conda install pytorch-nightly -c pytorch) and the same nightly's libtorch.s? (https://download.pytorch.org/libtorch/nightly/cpu/libtorch-macos-latest.zip).

When we release the stable version of 1.0 we will be adding version checks for models to make the errors more understandable. But the preview release doesn't do this.

Can you try downing a new nightly pytorch (conda install pytorch-nightly -c pytorch) and the same nightly's libtorch.s? (https://download.pytorch.org/libtorch/nightly/cpu/libtorch-macos-latest.zip).
When we release the stable version of 1.0 we will be adding version checks for models to make the errors more understandable. But the preview release doesn't do this.
body:
We think this issue is occuring because the version of PyTorch installed to generate the model is not the same as the version of `libtorch.so` being used to run it. Can you try downing a new nightly pytorch (`conda install pytorch-nightly -c pytorch`) and the same nightly's libtorch.s? (https://download.pytorch.org/libtorch/nightly/cpu/libtorch-macos-latest.zip). 

When we release the stable version of 1.0 we will be adding version checks for models to make the errors more understandable. But the preview release doesn't do this.
